description: Narrative text and descriptions for the Trap Disarmament subsystem

success.tripwire: Your trained eye catches the glint of wire stretched across the passage.
success.pressurePlate: The floor tile ahead sits slightly higher than its neighbors. A pressure plate.
success.electrified: The faint hum of electricity warns you of the charged grid ahead.
success.laserGrid: Faint red lines crisscross the corridor—Old World security lasers.
success.jotunDefense: Something ancient stirs at the edge of your perception. Jotun defenses.

failure.tripwire: Your foot catches the wire too late. A shrill alarm pierces the darkness.
failure.pressurePlate: The floor gives way beneath your foot. Something clicks—then strikes.
failure.electrified: The grid crackles to life as you step onto it. Lightning arcs through your body.
failure.laserGrid: The beam flares red as you break it. Doors slam shut. Alarms wail.
failure.jotunDefense: Ancient mechanisms awaken. Pain and noise erupt in equal measure.

generic.success: You spot the trap before it spots you. The mechanism lies dormant, waiting for its next victim.

success.tripwire: The wire goes slack in your hands. The trap is neutralized.
success.pressurePlate: With careful precision, you disable the pressure mechanism. Safe.
success.electrified: The crackling fades. The grid is now just harmless metal.
success.laserGrid: The beams flicker and die. You've blinded the ancient eye.
success.jotunDefense: The Jotun mechanism groans and falls silent. You've outsmarted the ancients.

critical.tripwire: Not only do you disable the wire, but you recover usable components from the mechanism.
critical.pressurePlate: With expert precision, you dismantle the trap entirely, salvaging valuable components.
critical.electrified: You not only disable the grid but carefully extract its power components. Excellent work.
critical.laserGrid: The system yields to your expertise. You salvage the focusing crystal and sensor module intact.
critical.jotunDefense: The ancient mechanism surrenders its secrets. You recover fragments of Jotun technology.

failure.default: The mechanism resists your efforts. You'll need to try a different approach—and it won't be any easier.

fumble.tripwire: Your tools slip at the worst moment. The alarm screams into the darkness.
fumble.pressurePlate: A wrong move—the mechanism triggers with you on top of it.
fumble.electrified: Your probe touches the wrong contact. Lightning answers your mistake.
fumble.laserGrid: You stumble into the beam. Doors seal. Alarms howl. You're trapped.
fumble.jotunDefense: The ancient defense senses your fumbling. It punishes such incompetence severely.

generic.critical: The trap is disabled and yields components.
generic.failure: The mechanism resists your efforts. You'll need to try a different approach—and it won't be any easier.

consequences.tripwire: Triggering this wire would sound an alarm, alerting nearby threats.
consequences.pressurePlate: Failure would release a crushing mechanism dealing 2d10 damage.
consequences.electrified: The grid would unleash 3d10 lightning damage through the conductive surface.
consequences.laserGrid: Breaking the beam would trigger alarms and seal all nearby doors.
consequences.jotunDefense: The ancient defense would unleash 5d10 damage and summon security constructs.

hints.tripwire: The wire is attached to a simple bell mechanism. Cutting it near the anchor would silence it.
hints.pressurePlate: The pressure sensor has a calibration screw. Loosening it would increase the trigger threshold.
hints.electrified: The power coupling on the left side appears to be the main feed. Disconnecting it first would be wise.
hints.laserGrid: The emitters cycle every few seconds. Timing your movements to the cycle is the key.
hints.jotunDefense: The mechanism hums in a pattern—ancient but recognizable. Matching the frequency with your tools might confuse it.

dcRevealed.template: The mechanism's complexity suggests a DC {dc} challenge.

forcedExecutionDescriptions.description: A fumble during disarmament triggers the trap directly on the disarmer.
forcedExecutionDescriptions.mechanicalEffect: Trap activates with disarmer as primary target. Trap is destroyed (no salvage possible).
forcedExecutionDescriptions.narrativeIntro: Your tools slip at the worst possible moment. The mechanism lurches—you hear a click, then a roar of energy. The trap executes its ancient purpose, with you at ground zero.

detection.name: Step 1: Detection
detection.successOutcome: Trap detected, may proceed to Analysis or Disarmament
detection.failureOutcome: Walk into trap, trigger effects immediately

analysis.name: Step 2: Analysis
analysis.successOutcome: Information revealed based on check result (DC, consequences, hints)

disarmament.name: Step 3: Disarmament
disarmament.successOutcome: Trap disabled. Critical success yields salvage.
disarmament.failureOutcome: DC +1 for next attempt. Fumble triggers [Forced Execution].

bareHands.name: Bare Hands
bareHands.description: Attempting without tools—significantly harder and restricted to low-DC traps (DC < 4 only).
bareHands.restriction: Cannot attempt traps with DC 4 or higher.

improvised.name: Improvised Tools
improvised.description: Makeshift tools cobbled together from available materials.

proper.name: Tinker's Toolkit
proper.description: A proper toolkit with quality tools for the job.

masterwork.name: Masterwork Tools
masterwork.description: Exceptional tools crafted by master artificers.

common.description: Basic materials useful for simple crafting projects.

rare.description: Advanced Old World technology, highly valued by artificers.

epic.description: Jotun-origin materials of extraordinary value and unknown potential.
